title: Valentine YES flow: update name and show provided final photo

requirements.summary: Replace the initial proposal name text with "Suzanne The Nazareth" and remove any remaining "Miss Nazareth" UI text.
acceptanceCriteria: On the initial screen, the headline reads exactly: "Will you be my Valentine, Suzanne The Nazareth?"
No other visible UI text still says "Miss Nazareth"

file_operations.description: Update the initial stage proposal headline text to exactly "Will you be my Valentine, Suzanne The Nazareth?" and ensure no remaining visible string uses "Miss Nazareth".

requirements.summary: Make the YES flow transition from celebration/meme stage to a final stage that displays the provided photo (no user upload required), with mobile-safe responsive layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking YES triggers the existing celebration/meme stage, then transitions to the final stage showing aman_suz_pic.jpeg.
The final stage displays the photo reliably on refresh/reload (i.e., it is served as a static asset, not dependent on runtime local upload).
The YES flow still works on mobile (iPhone/Android Chrome) without layout overflow or scroll issues.

file_operations.description: Remove the local-upload dependency from the YES flow: keep initial -> celebrating transition, then always transition to final after the existing meme delay, and render the final stage using the static asset at frontend/public/assets/aman_suz_pic.jpeg (no hidden file input and no upload prompts).

Adjust final-stage image/container responsiveness for small screens (e.g., constrain image height to viewport and ensure it scales without overflow) to keep the no-scroll single-screen layout working on mobile.

requirements.summary: Add aman_suz_pic.jpeg as a publicly served frontend asset and reference it from the final stage with existing final image styling.
acceptanceCriteria: The repository includes the image in a publicly served frontend path (e.g., under frontend/public) and the app references it via a stable /assets/... URL.
The image renders in the final stage with the existing final image styling (frame/border) and fits responsively.

file_operations.description: Add the provided uploaded image aman_suz_pic.jpeg to the app's publicly served static assets so it is reliably available on refresh/reload.
Reference the new static asset (frontend/public/assets/aman_suz_pic.jpeg) as the final-stage image source while keeping the existing final image frame/border styling.
